metadata.subject: How Increasing Income Inequality Is Dampening U.S. Economic Growth, And Possible Ways To Change The Tide

organizations: Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development (OECD)
Department of Housing and Urban Development (HUD)

relationships.description: S&P analyzing impact of income inequality on US economic growth
Collaborated on education and technology research

analysis.purpose: To analyze how income inequality affects US economic growth and propose solutions
analysis.significance: Comprehensive economic research from major rating agency showing income inequality dampens economic growth

notable_quotes: The current level of income inequality in the U.S. is dampening GDP growth, at a time when the world's biggest economy is struggling to recover from the Great Recession
A rising tide lifts all boatsâ€¦but a lifeboat carrying a few, surrounded by many treading water, risks capsizing
The U.S. ratio is much higher, at 14-to-1 (richest 10% vs poorest 10%)
red_flags: Income inequality approaching levels not seen since 1928
Education gap widening between income groups

blackmail_indicators.description: No evidence of blackmail or coercion in this economic research report

illegal_activity.description: This is an economic research report with no illegal activity discussed

public_knowledge.context: Income inequality was a major public policy topic in 2014, and this report from a major rating agency would have received media attention

analysis.summary: This Standard & Poor's research report analyzes how increasing income inequality in the United States is dampening economic growth, showing the US approaching inequality levels not seen since 1928. The report recommends educational improvements and cautious policy measures to address inequality while warning that extreme approaches could harm economic growth.
